d117b76a-8a61-40ae-8a0c-3fa22567cb34.description: The Leadership, Achievement, and Work (LAW) project aims to prepare qualified underrepresented and economically disadvantaged individuals who aspire to become licensed public interest attorneys in New York State for successful matriculation into the law school of their choice. The project aims to instill in these students, through an emphasis in labor law, the four principles of social justice: equity, access, civic participation, and human rights.
d117b76a-8a61-40ae-8a0c-3fa22567cb34.name: CSTEP Project L.A.W.

issuer.summary: issued by CUNY School of Labor and Urban Studies

entity.name: CUNY School of Labor and Urban Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Project L.A.W. students are able to read, analyze, and think critically about legal and social justice writings.

Project L.A.W. students have engaged with reading and analyzing court decisions and documentation relating to the core labor law principles of the National Labor Relations Act which is the federal law governing labor relations between employers and employees. Participants have also been exposed to the impact of the labor movement on civil rights in the United States.
Project L.A.W. students have received academic enrichment to enhance their writing skills within the discipline of law.
Project L.A.W. students have completed 10 weeks of LSAT preparation.

eed22250-58f4-4b84-a4ad-127a0c5f694d.description: Earners of this leadership badge have completed an intensive academic and service learning program that provides students with an opportunity to put their passion for social justice to work. Students learn first-hand how organizations advocate for economic, political, and racial justice as well as community/union empowerment by contributing to the movements themselves.
eed22250-58f4-4b84-a4ad-127a0c5f694d.name: Leadership Badge

issuer.summary: issued by CUNY School of Labor and Urban Studies

entity.name: CUNY School of Labor and Urban Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Students participate in experiential learning programs to develop a deeper understanding of how organizations effect change. Students have learned about the history of social movements, the impact of local and global organizations, agencies and their functions, and how to sharpen analytic skills to be effective organizers and leaders. In the process, students will have obtained professional experience to help build a career path in social justice and equity within expansive networks.

Students gain experience working for governmental agencies, unions, community-based organizations, and others. Activities include advocacy, policy development, research, budget development, professional writing, public speaking, organizing, project planning, and strategic planning.
